fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41228].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
- There are 3 cases here in the same field (Attachments label filter) of the Attachments Macro.

h2. Steps to Reproduce Case 1
# Create a space/page
# Attach some files
# Add a label to each file
# Edit the page and include the attachments macro
# While editing the macro, in the "Attachment labels", add a more than one label, following the macro description: "A comma-separated list of labels to filter by"
# Save it

h3. Expected Results
- Shows all attachments that have such labels

h3. Actual Results
- Nothing is shown

h2. Steps to Reproduce Case 2
- Same as Case 1 except for:
## Instead of adding a single label to an attachment, add the same labels you have added in the "Attachment labels" filter as a label to the attachment.
## An attachment has two or more labels

h3. Expected Results
- Shows all attachments that have such labels

h3. Actual Results
- Shows only the attachment that has all the labels

h2. Steps to Reproduce Case 3
- Same as Case 1 and 2 except for:
## Add more than one attachments macro in the page.
## Filter a single label
## Save it

h3. Expected Results
- Shows all attachments that have such labels

h3. Actual Results
- Every attachments macro that is filtered by a single label will show every attachment that has such label, including attachments that have more than one label. 

h3. Workarounds to show specific attachments
# Add the same label to every attachment you want to be shown with the macro as it work normally with one label as a filter.
# Add more than one label to an attachment(s) and filter by the same labels in the macro.

h3. Workarounds to show all attachments
# Add the same label to every attachment you want to be shown with the macro as it work normally with one label as a filter.
# Do not filter it
fields.summary: Attachment Macro - Filter by multiple labels not working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41227].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When using a Live Search Macro as an Unlicensed Access user (Service Desk Customer), the user is able to search content by selecting it from the search suggestions but when the user hits 'return' to run the search, he is redirected to /dosearchsite.action and sees "Not Permitted" 

h3. Environment
* Confluence Space shared through JIRA Service Desk

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link a JIRA Service Desk project to a Space
# Create a page on that space with a live search macro
# login as a Service Desk customer (user without Confluence or JIRA Application access)
# navigate to the page with the live search macro
# type on the box to see results. results can be selected and are available
# hit "Enter" on the keyboard

h3. Expected Results
Search results are shown.

h3. Actual Results
"Not Permitted" page is shown.

h3. Notes
* "Enter" redirects to /dosearchsite.action that is not accessible to "Unlicensed Access" users.
* Making the space public doesn't solve the problem.
* This was also noticed on the "Labels List" macro.

h3.Workaround
Click on results given by the live search.
fields.summary: Livesearch macro returns Not Permitted when Unlicensed Access searching

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41206].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Confluence allows for only one 'User Name Attribute' to be configured for each LDAP
 directory. For example, this is configured to be the *sAMAccountName* by default.  This functionality already exists in other products and allows users some flexibility as to which username they can log in with. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow for at least one alternate 'User Name Attribute' (commonly *userPrincipalName* on newer versions of Windows) to be configured for each directory. 

h3. Workaround 
No workaround found.

h3. Notes
The following bug might be relevant: [CONF-37275|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-37275]. When a 'User Name Attribute' is configured and users already exist in Confluence - if you then change this field to use a different attribute and sync the directory, Confluence will create new users instead of updating the current users.
fields.summary: Allow for users to log in with more than one 'User Name Attribute' per directory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41178].
  {panel}

Confluence 5.9 filters by default all unlicensed users from mentions, the people directory, and all search selectors, as well as from search results.

In some environments, it's appropriate to still let these users be seen, so that unlicensed users are visible in:
* mentions, to help with spelling. Note that when not a user is unlicensed, these should show with a different lozenge style
* people directory, quick search and site search, to look up contact info. Note that Confluence currently does not sync phone numbers, location or other user details from external systems, so this would only really be useful today for users that have in the past had a license.

Unlicensed users should still not be selectable by default as a contributor or author. There should be a separate checkbox on the site search and cql enabled macro editor screens to allow searching for content by these users, along the same lines as the archived spaces search option.

Unlicensed users should never be available as a target of a space permission or content restriction. Users need must be licensed before they can be assigned these.
fields.summary: Add option to control whether unlicensed users are hidden

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41170].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As an administrator, I would like better logging when an UnknownHostException is thrown in Confluence. Currently the following error is thrown in the Confluence logs and a white screen with no information is displayed in the UI:

{code}ERROR [http-nio-8080-exec-4] [net.sf.ehcache.Cache] <clinit> Unable to set localhost. This prevents creation of a GUID. Cause was: HOST: HOST: unknown error
 -- referer: http://HOST:port/setup/evallicense.action | url: /setup/setupembeddeddb-default.action | userName: anonymous | action: setupembeddeddb-default
java.net.UnknownHostException: HOST: HOST: unknown error
	at java.net.InetAddress.getLocalHost(InetAddress.java:1505){code}

h3. Suggested Solution
No web application should ever throw a blank screen on error. A message at that point something like E.G. = "Cannot validate license against hostname via DNS" would be to the point. Also, that message could be explicit in the logs, rather than "an unknown error."

Bonus: you could consider doing the validation against a call to "hostname" rather than handling it as a DNS lookup as shown in [java.net.UnknownHostException exceptions in Confluence log file due to DNS lookups failing|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/java-net-unknownhostexception-exceptions-in-confluence-log-file-due-to-dns-lookups-failing-394465548.html]. 

h3. Workaround 
Review the Confluence logs and edit the /etc/hosts file in order to succeed with installation.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I would like better logging when an UnknownHostException is thrown in Confluence

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41161].
  {panel}

The Confluence website has a login page that allows password auto-completion.
This means that users' credentials may be stored by their browser automatically, unless they have specifically configured their browser not to do so.

Note that most modern browsers will now offer to store credentials irrespective of web page password auto-completion settings. 

This issue will, however, be identified by an automated scanner, and so is included here for completion.

Recommendation:

Consider adding an attribute named "autocomplete" to the password field on the login page above that is set to "off" to explicitly demonstrate that credentials should not be stored, or, have a UI option to disable Password Auto complete.

Most modern web browsers will offer to store credentials regardless, however, this behavior may change in the future, as there is still some disagreement within the security community as to whether or not this configuration is appropriate. As such, consider performing a risk assessment to determine whether the potential risk resulting from a lack of this attribute is acceptable.
fields.summary: Provide a UI options to disable Password Autocomplete requests on the Login page

When you disable the Confluence Previews plugin under the System add-ons section (Confluence administration -> manage add-ons) and search for any attachment that would be previewed, after clicking over the attachment name in the search list results, you are taken to the page that contains the attachment, however the attachment is not downloaded.

h3.Steps to replicate:

1) Create a test page
2) Insert some attachment to this page (can be an image or pdf)
3) Go to the Confluence administration -> manage add ons -> show system add ons -> Disable Confluence Preview plugin
4) Go to the dashboard and search for the attachment name
5) Click over the attachment name

h3.Expected behavior
The download window should be presented.

h3.Actual behavior
You are presented to the page itself and nothing happens. The download doesn't start.

h3.Workaround
1) In order to download the attachment you must click over the ellipsis (...) and select attachments.
2) Click over the attachment name and you will be presented the download window.

h3.Additional investigation
It seems the Attachment URL in the search list is pointing to the preview functionality. EG:
{code}
http://Confluence_Base_URL/display/~admin/attachment+preview+test?preview=%2F6881293%2F6881294%2FTEST-testpdfexportimages-291215-1436-33.pdf.
{code}
The URL should be this one ton trigger the download. EG:
{code}
http://Confluence_Base_URL/download/attachments/6881293/TEST-testpdfexportimages-291215-1436-33.pdf?api=v2
{code}
fields.summary: Confluence tries to preview attachments even when preview plugin is disabled

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41100].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
All HTTP requests in Cloud have a 60 second timeout. When a PDF export runs longer than that, the task keeps running on the background but the .pdf generated is not returned to the customer. If another PDF export is triggered, Confluence tries to generate a new PDF, even though it already has one from the last export and again, it wont be downloadable.

There is also a 30 second retry done automatically by the smart-status timeout page from the client browser that will trigger new PDF exports. Confluence will deny a new PDF export to run with the message:
{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Too many concurrent exports. 1 is max allowed.
{noformat}
but as soon as the export finishes it will start a new PDF export.

PDF exports that take longer than 1 minute are high CPU tasks. This loop of generating new pdf files can render Cloud sites unusable on certain situations.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence Cloud page with 100 external images from another Cloud site (this will fail to retrieve images for the pdf at the rate of 1 image each second.
# Export page to PDF

h3. Expected Results
pdf file is downloadable at the end of the process. If it is not, then a new PDF export downloads the previous generated file if the page wasn't modified.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence generates a pdf indefinitely until the browser is stopped.
New PDF exports are rejected but as soon as it completes, it starts a new one when it is automatically requested by the smart-status 30 second refresh.

{{confluence/home/temp}} directory contains multiple .pdf files of the same page

h3. Suggestion
Confluence could detect that there is a pdf export already in the temp directory for the same unmodified page and transfer that to the browser or provide the option for the customer to decide; in case there is dynamic content on the page and a new pdf export is explicitly requested.

h3.Workaround
- Use the Space Tools PDF Export Option: as a Space Admin, Space Tools > Content Tools > Export
fields.summary: Long running PDF exports are not downloadable in Cloud

Confluence will send an email to a user who can 'Grant Access' whenever a user 'Request Access'' and the sequence that Confluence will use to search for the appropriate user is:
# The last person to edit the page
# All non-admin users that can set permissions on the page (given that an admin user can always set permissions)
# The page creator

Therefore, it would be more manageable to provide option for user to select only Space admin to receive an email to grant access to user to view Confluence page.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41075].
  {panel}

h4. Summary

- When exporting space(s) the "promoted" blueprints settings are lost, and have to mannualy promote them again in the imported space.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

- Promote a blueprint (bundled) in a space.
- Export the space as XML
- Import this space

h4. Expected Results

- The promoted blueprint setting remains.

h4. Actual Results

- Missing the promoted blueprint setting.

h4. Workaround

- Promote it again mannually in the imported space.
- Below you can do it through REST API.
# We strongly advise to definitely test these on a test/staging instance before applying them to actual prod one.
# The user credential to be used *must* have admin permission on that space.
# Providing username/password as plain text as the instruction is not recommended. You can try something like this to hide the actual password from being displayed in console:
https://coderwall.com/p/dsfmwa/securely-use-basic-auth-with-curl
# template_id and blueprint_id being used must exist in the destination instance.

h3. Template

{code:java}
curl -X PUT -u <username>:<password> 'http://<hostname>:<port>/<context_path>/rest/create-dialog/1.0/promotion/promote-template/<template_id>?spaceKey=<space_key>'
{code}
e.g.
{code:java}
curl -X PUT -u admin:admin 'http://localhost:1990/confluence/rest/create-dialog/1.0/promotion/promote-template/917505?spaceKey=BT'
{code}

h3. Blueprint

{code:java}
curl -X PUT -u <username>:<password> 'http://<hostname>:<port>/<context_path>/rest/create-dialog/1.0/promotion/promote-blueprint/<blueprint_id>?spaceKey=<space_key>'
{code}
e.g.
{code:java}
curl -X PUT -u admin:admin 'http://localhost:1990/confluence/rest/create-dialog/1.0/promotion/promote-blueprint/b47ea66c-35c2-4fd5-b595-06a894449e9d?spaceKey=BT'
{code}
fields.summary: include the "promoted" blueprint settings in a space XML export

If you are using version 5.8.16 or 5.8.17, or have used those versions in the past without running a script to fix the affected attachments, then you are likely affected by CONF-39975. Please see that ticket instead.

In some cases, it is legitimate for the message "Unknown attachment" to appear. For example:

* If you upload an attachment to a page and then delete it from the attachments list without removing the macro which references it, the macro will show "Unknown attachment".
* If you upload an attachment on Page-A and then reference it in a macro on Page-B, then delete the original Page-A, then the attachment will also be deleted. This causes the Page-B macro to display "Unknown attachment"

If you observed "unknown attachment" after one of these scenarios, this is not a bug, but rather expected behaviour.

If you observed "unknown attachment" by any other scenario, it is likely a bug. If you find a way to reproduce this issue, please let us know by commenting below, with details of how to reproduce the issue and your version of confluence. If you observe something different than an "unknown attachment" message but attachments do fail to download, please let us know exactly what you see. If you observe this issue but are not on and have never been on Confluence 5.8.16 or 5.8.17, please let us know below.

If you observe this issue you may try resolving the broken attachments using the same instructions outlined in CONF-39975 - let us know if it works or not for you.

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Previous Versions of Attachments uploaded to Confluence that contain a Special Character in their Title cannot be downloaded and generates a "Page Not Found" error

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.0.0-OD-2016.10 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload an attachment to a Confluence Page which contains a Special Character; for testing, used a Plus '+' character. Also breaks when file name contains ampersand (&)
# Modify the file and re-upload it to the same Confluence Page to generate a version
# Go to the Page's Attachments and click on a Previous Version (say Version 1) to download the previous version

h3. Expected Results
Previous version of the file prompts for download 

h3. Actual Results
Page opens in error and indicates "Page Not Found"
No Errors in log

h3. Notes
All versions under the parent (including the "Current") cannot be downloaded from the expanded view showing all versions however the titled Attachment (title of attachment) can be clicked on and downloaded without issues. 
!AttachmentVersions.png|thumbnail!

Unsure of other special characters which may affect this; have only tested with + 

h3.Workaround
Found that the URL displays the following:
{{https://HOSTNAME/wiki/download/attachments/2654266/Example%20Sheet%20%2B.xlsx?version=1&modificationDate=1457999001396&api=v2}}

After URL manipulation, found that the {{&modificationDate=1457999001396&}} section appears to break the URL. 

If it is removed and replaced with a Single Ampersand '&', the previous version file can be downloaded successfully: 

{{https://HOSTNAME/wiki/download/attachments/2654266/Example%20Sheet%20%2B.xlsx?version=1&api=v2}}

*Or*

Rename the current version of the file, removing the special character.
fields.summary: Unable to Download Previous Versions of Attachments Which Contain Special Characters in Title

h4. Problem
Using Chrome 50, Confluence editor will render half its height, causing UI usability problems, see the screenshot: 
!image-2016-03-13-08-59-03-220.png|thumbnail! 

Normally, the button bar would appear at the bottom of the browser, and the editor would take the full height. It works fine in Chrome 49 stable release and other browsers.

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Install Chrome 50.x
# Open Confluence and edit a page

h5. Cause
The affected version of Chrome introduced the following bug that is related to the issue: [display: table-row; doesn't work with height: 100%;	|https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=594376].

h4. Workaround
Apply the following stylesheet to Confluence Admin > Custom HTML > At end of the HEAD
{code}
<style type="text/css">
#content.edit
{ display: table-cell; }
</style>
{code}

Note: If the workaround appears to revert after a restart, but the custom HTML is still present, verify that there are no space level customizations in the affected area.

h4. Resolution
Upgrade to a release that contains the fix (Confluence 5.9.7 or higher).
fields.summary: Editor shows at half height when using Chrome 50+

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41014].
  {panel}

This wouldn't often be recommended, but these values can be altered to trade off the potential for data integrity issues in favour of uptime, or vice versa.

To set the Hazelcast heartbeat to 60s (for example): Add the JVM parameter {{-Dconfluence.cluster.hazelcast.max.no.heartbeat.seconds=60}}

To modify the Cluster Safety interval or disable the job entirely: {{Admin > Scheduled jobs}}

h3. How these two settings operate
Hazelcast is Confluence's distributed caching mechanism. Data will be stored in the cache on one node only, and when other nodes want that data, they contact the node that has it. If no node has it, they query the database. Hazelcast controls the cluster membership. If a node has not communicated with the other nodes in the cluster for the heartbeat period (30s by default), the other nodes will remove it from the cluster. It will then not be able to contact the shared cache until it has successfully rejoined the cluster.

[Cluster safety|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Recovering+from+a+Data+Center+cluster+split-brain] is a scheduled job that runs on each node in a cluster, every 30s by default. It compares a number in Hazelcast's cache to a number in the database. If the numbers differ, the node will throw a panic event and stop processing. It is intended to ensure that all nodes that are able to communicate with the database, are also communicating with Hazelcast's shared cache, to avoid writing out of date data to the database, and overwriting more recent edits.

h3. Some example configurations
h5. Uptime over data integrity
* Change both to 1 minute - this would mean you could have network interruptions or GC pauses up to 1 minute without triggering cluster panics. However, in the rare case that two nodes are no longer communicating, there would be a maximum of a 1 minute interval where the data on each node may be out of sync, and this could cause conflicting data to be written to the database.
* Leaving the hazelcast timeout at 30 seconds and cluster safety to 10 minutes would allow nodes to be evicted from and rejoin the cluster (eg after a 30s GC or network blip), without a cluster panic occurring. This would mean that the cluster could potentially operate in a 'split brain' scenario where the nodes do not rejoin, for up to 10 minutes before throwing a panic. However, it would give evicted nodes a lot more time to rejoin the cluster gracefully after eviction.

h5. Data integrity over uptime
* Change both to 15 seconds - this sacrifices uptime for more confidence around data integrity. It means a maximum of 15 seconds where nodes could be out of communication with each other and still writing to the database. It could mean that GCs and network blips over 15 seconds will trigger a cluster panic, so you would run the risk of having more outages.
* Change the hazelcast timeout to 1 minute and the cluster safety job to 15 seconds - this would mean GCs etc could run for up to 1 minute without nodes being evicted from the cluster. However, once they are evicted, the time they could potentially write to the database is lowered to 15 seconds.
fields.summary: Allow cluster safety and hazelcast heartbeat intervals to be configurable

h3. Summary
Per [Widget Connector Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/widget-connector-macro-171180449.html] you can insert the URL for a public Google Calendar. However, upon doing that, you get the image below:

 !Screen Shot 2016-03-09 at 17.07.53.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* Confluence	6.0.0-OD-2016.10.1-1071
* Widget Connector 3.0.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create new page in Confluence
# Type {Widget Connector and insert the required macro
# Use URL to a Public Calendar that I created: {noformat}https://calendar.google.com/calendar/embed?src=efisg1vnagrlup2bqkbblsn27k%40group.calendar.google.com&ctz=Europe/Amsterdam{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
Calendar should embed

h3. Actual Results
Shows image that I displayed in the Summary.
 
h3. Notes
May be related to CONF-40742

h3.Workaround

1. In the editor, open the macro browser
2. Search for "iframe" and insert it
3. In the dialog, set the URL to calendar embed URL, I used the one included in this issue description.
4. Set the height/width to the dimensions you'd like.
5. Click "Insert"
6. Publish your page
fields.summary: Widget Connector no longer works with Google Calendar

*Situation 1: Saving manually*
- Create a confluence page
- (OSX) hold CRTL and CMD and then press the Space bar
- Choose an unusual emoji (such as the one in the screenshot attached to this issue)
- Press the save button, which will result in the error that I have attached to this issue as well

*Situation 2: Saving automatically*
(This is what killed our Confluence instance last week)
- Create a confluence page and add an 'unusual' emoji
- Wait for the auto-save feature to kick in

In my case, I left the window open while I was working on something else. The auto-save feature tried to save the page over and over again. Our confluence page became unusable and we had to restart it.

We tried to recreate both situations on our acceptance instance of Confluence. Situation 1 was easily recreated. But situation 2 didn't bring Confluence down this time. It might be that we didn't leave the window open long enough.
fields.summary: Adding 'unusual' Emoji result in a System Error and might be able to take down Confluence

When the Page Properties Report Macro returns more that 30 pages a pagination possibility occurs where the user has a possibility to change to another page and see more results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create some pages with a "Page Property macro" (About 10 should be Ok to test it). Label them as "Test".
# Create a page with a Page Property Report Macro, and configure it to show the results of  "Test" label. Set it to display 5 pages. 
# The report will show the 5 results under it's first page.
# Click on "Next" to see the next 5 results.

h3. Expected Results

Then next 5 results are displayed.

h3. Actual Results

The report still shows the first 5 pages
 
h3. Notes
You can set the report to show up to 30 results at once. The downside is that you won't be able to see any other result in case you have more than 30 pages retrieve by the macro.


h3.Workaround

No workaround so far.
fields.summary: Pagination in the Page Properties Report Macro do not work when properties are not plain text

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40988].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When a page has one macro within another macro, let's say a Warning macro within an Info macro, and at least 2 users are editing this page at the same time, and both users save the page, the macro within breaks after the second user saves the page, see screenshot.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Add an Info macro and within the Info macro add a Warning macro
# Save the page
# With one user, edit the page
# Access this page with another user and also edit the page
# While both users are editing the page at the same time the first user saves the page, and the second user also saves the page right after

h3. Expected Results
After the second user saves the page, the macro within the other macro, on this case the Warning macro, should still be viewable
h3. Actual Results
The macro within the other macro breaks. A message saying "Broken macro" is displayed
 
h3. Notes
There's no need for both users to save the page at the exact same time (instantaneously).

h3.Workaround
As a workaround, when a User edits the problem page, the user can add an edit restriction for the page and restrict editing to themselves. This restoration will need to be removed after editing the page. This is a rather tedious workaround, but it will prevent the issue until the problem is resolved.

*NB: In the unlikely event that anyone experiences this issue post 5.10.4, it is because the macros were entered on the page some time ago, before macro ids were used. If this does occur, the workaround is to revert to the old version, then save the page (ensuring no one else is editing it at the same time). Once a single-session save has occurred, the macro will have an id, and the problem will be solved for that page forever.*
fields.summary: Macro within another macro is broken after the second user saves the page

JIRA has a nice config.sh script in /bin directory where it is easy to point the installation to an existing database (Postgres in my my case).

Confluence does not seem to have this. After a clean install of Confluence there is only the confluence.cfg.xml file, but that does not yet contain the XML for any database.

With a similar config script it would be easy to fill in the details for my particular case. Alternatively there could be commented out sections in the XML config that would clearly show what needs to be added.

Also on the website the instructions on server migration is not clear with regards to using an existing database with a fresh install. There is only the small note on the following page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/migrating-to-another-database-148867.html
fields.summary: Provide same tool support for Confluence configuration as for JIRA
